AEROSPACE IN EUROPE Quarterly News Briefing December 2016
WELCOME
Welcome to the first Honeywell Aerospace in Europe Quarterly News Briefing. I value our meetings this past year and in response to our discussions I am instituting this quarterly communication to continue our connection. Each issue will briefly highlight the latest Honeywell Aerospace activities in Europe, as well as our technology advancements, spanning the commercial, defense and space industries. From our active work in the Single European Sky initiative, to our everyday focus on developing technology that delivers safer, faster, more efficient and comfortable experiences, we are invested in and aligned with the future of aerospace in Europe. I look forward to our next meeting, but until then I hope you enjoy the reading. If you don’t want to receive these messages in the future, please reply to me here <[[mailto:james.bryson@honeywell.com; jake.saylor@honeywell.com]]>.
James Bryson
President, Europe, Middle East, Africa & India, Honeywell Aerospace
NEWS PICK Top Three Stories
NEW BRITISH ARMORED FIGHTING VEHICLES TO USE HONEYWELL ADVANCED NAVIGATION TECHNOLOGY
Honeywell’s TALIN <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/products/navigation-and-sensors/talin-inertial-land-navigator-family]]> inertial land navigation technology has been selected for installation on the British Army’s new AJAX armored fighting vehicles. TALIN is a battle-tested navigation solution that can improve mission success in difficult terrain by providing users with a lightweight and highly accurate laser guidance system. Learn more <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/press-release-listing/2016/november/honeywell-to-provide-advanced-navigation-system-to-new-british-armored-fighting-vehicles]]>.
HONEYWELL JETWAVE MAKES INFLIGHT WI-FI REAL
From satellites, to hardware and services, to mobile apps, Honeywell is changing the way people communicate at 40,000 feet. Learn more. <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/news-listing/2016/november/honeywell-jetwave-makes-inflight-wifi-real]]>
HONEYWELL TECHNOLOGY WINS AIRBUS INNOVATION AWARD
Airbus recognized Honeywell for its Weather on Board technology at the Airbus Best in Class Partner Awards 2016. Initiated as part of SESAR, the Weather on Board application helps airlines improve flight safety, increase pilot efficiency and maximize passenger comfort. Learn more. <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/press-release-listing/2016/october/honeywell-weather-on-board-technology-wins-airbus-innovation-award]]>
